content.text: Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) has seen fluctuations in its price, moving from $84,016.10 to $85,837.56. Its 24-hour trading volume was recorded at $129,257,441, with a market cap of $10,849,705,987. The daily change was 0.0222%.

Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) experienced minor price changes, ranging from $2,216.79 to $2,236.32. Its 24-hour trading volume was $720,623,345, with a market cap of $6,453,227,073. The daily change was 0.0095%.

Solana (SOL) showed notable volatility, with its price fluctuating between $143.60 and $148.06. Its 24-hour trading volume was $329,499,325, though its market cap was not provided. The daily change was 0.1193%.
The ai16z token saw a decline in price from $0.4034 to $0.3596.

categories.title: ElizaOS Plugin Documentation and UI Enhancements

content.text: Recent updates to ElizaOS include improvements to plugin documentation and UI enhancements. The documentation now includes guidance on using custom plugins that are not in the official registry, ensuring users can integrate their own plugins seamlessly.

A new UI update introduces support for agent configuration with plugins and environment variables. This update also refines UI components, including plugin and secret management, and adds a mechanism for creating new characters.

A new page has been added to showcase various ElizaOS plugins, along with a changelog and a blog section. Efforts are being made to automate updates and distribute them via multiple channels, including documentation, Telegram, and AI agents.
The plugin showcase is still missing around 60 plugins, as logos are being created. This marks the fourth attempt at creating a plugin explorer, now integrated into the documentation.

categories.title: AI Agents and Their Growing Ecosystem

content.text: AI Agent Dev School is back, with sessions on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 6 PM PST. The sessions will also be recorded for later viewing.
Gelato Network has released an ultimate guide to ElizaOS, featuring a live AI Agent Coinflip mini-game on Inkonchain.
AI Agent robot dogs could become a reality, with Meta PARTNR making interesting advancements in this space.
Carra Wu from a16z and Eskender from ai16zdao (ElizaOS) participated in a panel at Ethereum Denver discussing the future of the agent-to-agent economy.

categories.title: Future of Entertainment and Virtual Interaction

content.text: Smaller AI models could drive the future of entertainment by being more efficient, consuming less power, and fitting into more devices. This could lead to a resurgence of robot pets, helping to normalize AI companionship in daily life.

A population the size of a mid-sized city equipped with motion capture hardware in real-time 3D environments could create a mini virtual Hollywood, revolutionizing digital entertainment and content creation.
